small #rstats #rdatatable tip -- we have %chin% to do %in% for _ch_aracter vectors. it's the same as %in%, just faster.

why only character vectors? internally, %chin% takes advantage of the R global string cache to be faster than %in%.

see also chmatch ‚ÜîÔ∏è match for characters

Confused between `colour` or `fill` in #ggplot?
+ `colour` is for 1D things in your plot, e.g. lines around a boxplot
+ `fill` is for colour 2D things in your plot, e.g. the insides of a boxplot
